function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Positive correlation between urban wildlife support and vegetation structure may lead to increased contact between humans and wildlife, increasing the risk of zoonotic disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease transmission from wildlife to humans, potentially causing outbreaks of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to reduce human-wildlife contact, such as barriers, education programs, and controlled access to wildlife habitats.","Technologies":"Remote monitoring systems, wildlife tracking devices, and contactless visitor management systems.","People":"People visiting or living near green spaces, wildlife populations in urban areas.","Owner":"Local government, wildlife conservation organizations, urban planning authorities."},{"Description":"Presence of non-native and invasive plant species negatively affecting avian and lepidopteran communities, potentially leading to population decline and loss of biodiversity.","Impact":"Decreased diversity and abundance of birds and lepidopteran species, leading to imbalanced ecosystems and reduced ecosystem services.","Mitigation":"Implement strategies to control and manage invasive species, including removal, habitat restoration, and promoting native plant diversity.","Technologies":"Remote sensing for early detection of invasive species, precision herbicide application, and genetic techniques for species identification.","People":"Bird and lepidopteran populations, environmental conservation organizations, land managers.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, land management authorities, conservation groups."},{"Description":"Design features such as water bodies, footpaths alignment, and habitat heterogeneity may impact human behavior and perception, potentially affecting the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Risk of increased or decreased human interactions in green spaces, leading to potential disease spread or changes in wildlife behavior.","Mitigation":"Implement signage, education campaigns, and spatial design interventions to promote safe and responsible behavior in green spaces.","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping for risk analysis, crowd monitoring systems, and virtual reality simulations for spatial planning.","People":"Visitors and users of green spaces, local communities, wildlife in urban environments.","Owner":"Urban planners, park management authorities, public health agencies."}]}
